item.text: Botulinum Toxin Injection Contraindication
Does the beneficiary have a condition that is a contraindication to receiving botulinum toxin?
Does the beneficiary have existing medical condition(s) which could affect the neuromuscular function?
Does the beneficiary have a hypersensitivity to any botulinum toxin preparation or to any of the components in the formulation of the serotype?
Does the beneficiary have a severe clotting disorder?
Does the beneficiary have an infection at the proposed injection site?
Provider education note; any of the above contraindications will indicate botulinum toxin is not reasonable nor necessary.​
Order Details
Order date
Requested procedure date of service
The requested procedure is one of the following
Proposed frequency of injections.  Provider Note: Administration must not be given more frequently than every 12 weeks, regardless of diagnosis, unless specifically address in the policy.
Order Description; A request for injection of chemical (botulinum toxin) for destruction of nerve muscles (chemodenervation).

valueCoding.display: CPT 64612 - Chemodenervation of muscles(s); muscle(s) innervated by facial nerve, unilateral (e.g.m for blepharospasm, hemifacial spasm)
CPT 64615 - Chemodenervation of muscles(s); muscle(s) innervated by facial, trigeminal, cervical, spinal and accessory nerves, bilateral (e.g., for chronic migraine)

item.text: The medically necessary reason that supports Guidance procedure code CPT 95873 or CPT 95874  (if applicable) in conjunction with chemodenervation

valueCoding.display: CPT 95873 - Muscle stimulation guidance will be used during chemodenervation to avoid the documented structures that are adjacent to or behind the target muscle, reducing the risk of complications.​
CPT 95874 - Electromyographic guidance for chemodenervation to avoid the documented structures that are adjacent to or behind the target muscle, reducing the risk of complications​

item.text: Covered Diagnosis
Provider education: There must be objective documentation of the clinical features consistent with the covered diagnosis in the beneficiary record.
J0585 INJECTION, ONABOTULINUMTOXINA, 1 UNIT in conjunction with 64612 - allowable diagnosis:

Medical Necessity Documentation

Provider Education Note:  Specific information must be documented about the conservative methods of treatments such as medication, physical therapy, and other appropriate methods that have been tried and proven unsuccessful.  The documentation must include an objective assessment of the intolerance or inadequacy of the response(s). (Excludes hemifacial spasm or blepharospasm)​
Unsuccessful or inadequate response to treatments (Excludes hemifacial spasm or blepharospasm)​
Medication(s) that have been attempted.
Anticholinergics (Muscarinic receptor antagonist)
Benzodiazepine
Skeletal Muscle Relaxants
Specify Other:
Conventional treatment methods that have been attempted.
Beneficiary's therapeutic response to treatments attempted
Pertinent test/procedure results

Medication(s) that have been attempted for chronic migraines with at least a 2-month trial.​ Provider Education Note: The beneficiary has had a trial of and inadequate response to a 2-month trial of at least one agent in any two of the following classes or has contraindication to the following medications.
Tricyclic Antidepressants
Beta Blocker
Calcium Channel Blocker
Antiepileptic
Specify Other:
History of Chronic Migraines Documentation​
Documented features of migraine headache ≥ 8 migraine headache days per month​
Migraine headache documented to be lasting for a duration ≥4 hours on a migraine day​
Supports monthly headache days have occurred ≥15 headaches days per month​
Chronic headaches have been present for a period of at least 3 months​
Unsuccessful or inadequate response to treatments specific to Migraines​​

Medication(s) that have been attempted for chronic migraines with at least a 2-month trial.​ Provider Education Note: The beneficiary has had a trial of and inadequate response to a 2-month trial of at least one agent in any two of the following classes or has contraindication to the following medications.
Tricyclic Antidepressants
Beta Blocker
Calcium Channel Blocker
Antiepileptic
Specify Other:
Calcitonin gene-related peptide agent for chronic migraine prophylaxis is currently used.​
